title: 106_hr2817
content: The Act may be cited as the "Certified Nurse Midwifery Medicare Services Act of 1999" and includes provisions for Medicare payment for certified nurse-midwife and midwife services. The "Certified Nurse Midwifery Medicare Services Act of 1999" amends the Social Security Act to define certified midwife services as those provided by individuals with specific qualifications and authorized by state law. The heading in section 1861(gg) of the Social Security Act is amended to meet guidelines prescribed by the Secretary or certified by a recognized organization. The heading in section 1861(gg) of the Social Security Act is amended to include "Certified Nurse-Midwife Services; Certified Midwife Services". The Social Security Act is amended to include certified nurse-midwife and certified midwife services. This allows patients to receive care from certified nurse-midwives or certified midwives. The Social Security Act is amended to include certified nurse-midwife and certified midwife services, allowing them to provide inpatient hospital services at teaching hospitals. This includes teaching or supervising interns or residents-in-training in obstetrics and gynecology. The Social Security Act is amended to include certified nurse-midwife and certified midwife services in teaching hospitals, allowing them to provide inpatient services and supervise interns or residents-in-training in obstetrics and gynecology. The Social Security Act is amended to include certified nurse-midwife and certified midwife services in teaching hospitals for inpatient services and supervision of interns or residents-in-training in obstetrics and gynecology. The Social Security Act is amended to include certified nurse-midwife and certified midwife services in teaching hospitals for inpatient services and supervision of interns or residents-in-training in obstetrics and gynecology. Amendments include increasing payment to 95 percent for certified nurse-midwife services, allowing payment for certified midwife services, and specifying payment assignment for these services. The Social Security Act is amended to include certified nurse-midwife and certified midwife services in teaching hospitals. Payment can be made to designated persons or entities under an agreement. Amendments clarify payments for services furnished in teaching hospitals. The Social Security Act is amended to include certified nurse-midwife and certified midwife services in teaching hospitals. "Medicare payment for freestanding birth center services is addressed in Section 3." The curr_chunk discusses the definition of freestanding birth center services and freestanding birth centers under the Social Security Act. It defines the services provided by a freestanding birth center and the criteria for what constitutes a freestanding birth center. The curr_chunk further amends the definition of freestanding birth centers under the Social Security Act, specifying the criteria for approval and accreditation. The curr_chunk amends the definition of freestanding birth centers under the Social Security Act, specifying approval and accreditation criteria. The curr_chunk amends the Social Security Act to include freestanding birth center services in medical benefits under Part B. The curr_chunk specifies that payment for freestanding birth center services under section 1861(s)(2)(L)(ii) will be made on an assignment-related basis, at 80 percent of the actual charge or an amount set by the Secretary. This amount is based on 95 percent of the average total payment to hospitals and physicians in 1997 for delivery and pre-delivery visits, adjusted for regional labor cost variations. The curr_chunk specifies that payment for freestanding birth center services will be made on an assignment-related basis, at 80 percent of the actual charge or an amount set by the Secretary, excluding certain costs like diagnostic tests and drugs. The payment amount will be updated using a single conversion factor for 1998. The Secretary of Health and Human Services may issue interim regulations to implement the amendments made by this Act within 6 months of enactment, with public comment opportunity.
